inlineContent.text: Implement page navigation, jumping to specific pages,
and navigation history management in PDF documents.
Implement buttons to navigate to previous/next pages.
Check the state with canGoToNextPage and canGoToPreviousPage.
Navigate directly to a specific page number.
Get the page with page(at:) from PDFDocument and call go(to:).
Get current page information.
Use currentPage and document.index(for:).
PDFView provides various methods for
programmatic page navigation.
- Navigate to a specific page
Allow users to enter a page number directly
to navigate to the desired page.
Implement using TextField combined with validation.
Create a page number input field and navigation button.
Validate that the input value is within a valid range.
Navigate directly with the keyboard Return key.
Use onSubmit or textFieldShouldReturn.
Quickly browse pages with a slider.
Implement with real-time preview.
PDFDestination represents a specific location within a document.
It includes not just the page but also coordinates within the page and zoom level.
It’s mainly used in bookmarks and table of contents links.
Navigate to a specific location on a page using PDFDestination.
Save the current location as a PDFDestination.
This is the foundation for implementing bookmark functionality.
Extract destinations from the PDF document’s outline (table of contents).
Navigate through PDFOutline to create a navigation menu.
Implement back/forward buttons.
Navigate through the history of pages the user has visited.
Detect page changes with Notifications.
Subscribe to PDFViewPageChanged notification.
Observe page changes using Combine in SwiftUI.
Convert to Publisher to update state.
Implement “back/forward” navigation like a web browser.
PDFView provides canGoBack, canGoForward properties
and goBack(), goForward() methods.
Which property in PDFView checks if navigation to the next page is possible?
If canGoToNextPage is true, you can
call goToNextPage().
canGoToNextPage
hasNextPage
Check the exact PDFView API.
isLastPage
Whether it’s the last page and whether you can navigate forward
are different concepts.
Which class represents a specific location (page + coordinates + zoom) within a PDF document?
Check the location-related class name in PDFKit.
PDFLocation
PDFDestination represents a location within a document
including page, coordinates, and zoom level.
PDFDestination
PDFBookmark
Bookmarks need to be implemented separately,
and location information is handled by a different class.
PDFViewPageChanged
Subscribe to Notification.Name.PDFViewPageChanged
to receive page change events.
Notifications are sent from PDFView.
Check the exact name.
PDFDocumentPageChanged
This is not the format for Notification names.
Check the PDFKit notification naming convention.
pageDidChange
What is the Notification name to subscribe to for detecting page changes?

abstract.text: Implement text search within PDF documents,
highlight results, and navigate between them.

using the PDFKit framework.

and properly handle loading states and errors.
